title: How to Make a Picture for a Notebook

steps.headline: Use appropriate software for creating a picture.
steps.description: Fore example, Microsoft Word, Pages on a Mac, or something similar. Alternatively, if you don't want to do a digital drawing, draw by hand or trace a picture.

steps.headline: Choose a picture.
steps.description: The options are endless here but it should be something you'd enjoy looking at and that you can easily draw. Perhaps do a picture of yourself, your family, a pet or an object you like. Or, a scene, such as your garden or your local street.

steps.headline: Draw the image.
steps.description: If doing it digitally, you can transform a photo into an image, then add special features with the drawing tool. If you wish, draw by hand, then scan the image into the computer and make additions using the computer program.

steps.headline: Ensure that the image will be large enough to fit the whole page of your notebook.
Create a border.
steps.description: Underneath your picture, you can write something like 'My notebook' or your name and the topic of the notebook. Have something that links to what you're using the notebook for.

steps.headline: Print it out from a printer.
steps.description: If you don't have one, then put it in your USB and go to a store that will print it out for you.

steps.headline: Stick the new picture cover onto your notebook.
steps.description: Use super glue, clear tape or something else that is made to adhere paper to paper.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: You now have a lovely new notebook cover.

steps.headline: Choose stickers, foam stick-ons, lots of magazine pictures, and so forth.
steps.description: Choose decorative items that you like and have freely available at home. You can also add sequins, buttons, pieces of ribbon or lace, and so forth.

steps.headline: Plan the layout for the notebook.
steps.description:
The idea is to completely cover the notebook page, so that the original design can no longer be seen. Options for this include:
Stick rows of the same-sized stickers on the notebook. Use images to make a decoupage or collage look. Design an image and use the stickers or images to create the design (you can stick a piece of plain paper on first, for the background). Write your name or another word in stickers or images. Make a scene, such as a zoo, a field, a city street, inside a house, and so forth.

steps.headline: Attach the items according to the design you've come up with.
steps.description: Stick carefully so that the items won't come off easily when bumped or carried in your bag

steps.headline: Paint with a sealant if wished.
steps.description: This step isn't necessary but it can help to prevent 'dog-ears', scratches and loose pieces after you've finished. A layer of Mod Podge, for example, can seal everything in nicely. Alternatively, stick neat rows of tape over it all, to create a splash-proof cover.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: You now have a new and more fascinating notebook.
